Context:
Program Name: Fashion Techniques and Design
Code: F113
Credential: Ontario College Diploma
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 2 years (4 semesters)
Starting Months: January, September
Domestic Tuition: $4,755.00 *
International Tuition: $18,792.00 **
Centre: Arts, Design & Information Technology
School: Fashion & Jewellery
Location: Casa Loma Campus
Program Description: Prepares students for a career in garment-manufacturing design rooms with a focus on women's wear and pattern drafting and sewing skills. Covers technical illustration, pattern making, pattern grading, clothing construction, textiles, technical specifications, and history of costume.
Electives: fashion show development, portfolio development, draping, lingerie, men's pattern drafting, leather apparel, knitwear, bridal and evening wear.
Core Courses: Adobe Illustrator, pattern drafting, pattern grading.
Semester Availability: Fall 2024 (Domestic: Open, International: Open), Winter 2025 (Domestic: Open, International: Opens Apr 8, 2024), Spring 2025 (Not Available, Not Available).
Related Programs: Fashion Management (F102), Fashion Business Industry (F112), International Fashion Management (Postgraduate Certificate) (F412).

* Domestic tuition may be subject to change based on the student's province of residence or other factors.
** International tuition is for the entire 2-year program and may be subject to change.

Context:
The Fashion Techniques and Design program at the School of Fashion and Jewellery offers education in various aspects of fashion design and creation, including Adobe Illustrator, pattern drafting, and pattern grading. Students will have opportunities to showcase their work at annual fashion shows and portfolio events, network with industry professionals, participate in competitions, work on applied research projects, volunteer, and attend industry events.

Requirements for the program include access to a personal laptop or desktop computer, printer, and reliable Internet for classes. Students who begin in January will study through the spring/summer semester and continue into the September academic year, making the program condensed to 1.5 years for them. Extensive sewing experience and access to a sewing machine outside of campus facilities are expected.

Graduates can pursue careers as pattern drafting or construction designers, drafting and construction specifications specialists, product developers, assistant designers, technical designers, patternmakers, samplemakers, assistant apparel technicians, graders, marker makers, technical illustrators, product developers, stylists, design, trend and style consultants, and social media professionals.

Graduates with a minimum program GPA of 2.7 are eligible for admission to George Brown postgraduate programs. Students who successfully complete the program with a grade point average of 3.5 or higher may be eligible for admission into fashion programs at other post-secondary institutions.

Courses in the program are not explicitly mentioned in the text but can be found in the Printable Curriculum Planner 2024-2025 on their website.

Extracted Information:

The following is a list of required courses for each semester in the Fashion program at the college during the academic year 2024-2025:

Semester 1:
- FASH 1033: Technical Illustration
- FASH 1082: World of Fashion
- FASH 1107: Fabric Science: Textiles
- FASH 1115: Fundamental Pattern Drafting
- FASH 1117: Construction I – Theory and Practice
- COMM 2000: Communicating Across Contexts

Semester 2:
- FASH 1031: Fabric Analysis
- FASH 1061: Torso Drafting
- FASH 1122: Construction II: Theory and Practice
- FASH 1153: Technical Specifications and Development
- FASH 1159: Design and Colour for Fashion
- GNED: General Education Elective

Semester 3:
- FASH 2038: Advanced Torso Drafting
- FASH 2056: Construction III – Theory and Practice
- FASH 2064: Pattern Grading and Marker Making
- FASH [Program Elective]: (choose one) - COMP 1174: Adobe Illustrator or GNED: General Education Elective

Semester 4:
- FASH 1091: History of Costume/
- FASH 2046: Construction IV – Theory and Practice
- FASH 2051: Advanced Drafting
- FASH [Program Elective]: (choose one) - GNED: General Education Elective

Additional Information:
- Students may be required to take COMM 1000 (Introduction to College Communication) before progressing to COMM 2000. This course does not count as a required course for graduation and students will be charged for this extra course.
- Program elective choices vary from semester to semester and include FASH 1002: P.D.S. (Pattern Drafting System), FASH 1086: Adobe Photoshop for Fashion, FASH 1125: Lingerie, FASH 1137: Build a Design Studio, FASH 1187: Colour & Trend Forecasting, and FASH 1190: Introduction to the Pattern Aided Design (PAD): Tool and Pattern Design Functions.
- There is no specific year or contact information provided in the text.

Context: The George Brown College offers a program in Fashion and Jewellery. For international students, country-specific admission requirements can be found on the International Admissions page. Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges, while international students should use the George Brown College Online Application System. The program has admission requirements including an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent, grade 12 English (C or U), and grade 11 Math (M or U) or grade 12 (C or U). Applicants with intermediate sewing experience and basic computer literacy have a better chance to succeed. Mature students may take the Admissions Assessment for English and math or upgrade their credits. The program involves extensive sewing and drafting, and both sewing ability and access to a sewing machine outside of campus facilities are expected. Course exemptions may be possible with college or university credits. For more information, contact the School of Fashion and Jewellery at 416-415-5000, ext. 4840 or fashionandjewellery@georgebrown.ca. Applicants must note that students who start in January will be required to attend classes during summer months.
